TopicTitle: Jebediah A Kerbal's Journey | Cinematic - Movie KSP (30min.)

Articles.Content:
Hi everyone, it's been a long time. Today I propose you "Jebediah A Kerbal's Journey".
The sequel of one of my previous video, "Jebediah A Kerbal Story". I hope you will appreciate,
this 30 minutes cinematic movie of mine. 

Feel free to share your thoughts and to ask your questions if you have some.
Take care

Oraldo Revak
This is awesome! What video editor did you use? I'm learning to make my own videos and I'm struggling to find one that works well for me.

On 3/4/2022 at 3:43 PM, AlchemistZ7 said:

This is awesome! What video editor did you use? I'm learning to make my own videos and I'm struggling to find one that works well for me. 

Hi, thank you. I'm using Sony Vegas Pro. I know that's there's better video editor, but I'm used to it for years

On 3/7/2022 at 10:25 AM, Oraldo revak said:

Hi, thank you. I'm using Sony Vegas Pro. I know that's there's better video editor, but I'm used to it for years

Yeah I want to but video editing is not good for me but the video is really good.

I also have no idea how you modified the kerbals to make them more individual, and how you created the scenes where they interact, such as in mission control. It doesn't look like something that can be done in the game.

6 hours ago, AlchemistZ7 said:

I also have no idea how you modified the kerbals to make them more individual, and how you created the scenes where they interact, such as in mission control. It doesn't look like something that can be done in the game.

It is made in game it takes a lot of time to make and do things need to be do. For the mods I saw texture replacer(I am guessing for the kerbals you are talking about), Restock(ship parts look different and I know what restock looks like), Waterfall and related mods(Engine plumes) and graphic mods.
